channel.title: Which File handles the runescape map area?
channel.description:
I'm not exactly sure how to explain this, but in certain clients all of the areas show up (for instance you can travel to the Gnome Stronghold), but other clients will have the Gnome Stronghold completely black. Which file(s) handle which parts of the runescape map are actually displayed, and which are completely blacked off.
Thank you. :)

item.title: Which File handles the runescape map area?
item.dc:creator: @Palagerini Palagerini
item.description:
@Palagerini wrote:

Strange enough, when I replaced the models file the map appeared. Thank you!

Read full topic
item.source: Which File handles the runescape map area?

I dont see why not

item.title: Which File handles the runescape map area?
item.dc:creator: @Palagerini Palagerini
item.description:
@Palagerini wrote:

Thank you. So if I had a client that had Gnome Stronghold available and a client that didn’t have it available, then would I just replace the main_file_cache 's? Or is there no way to change it?

Read full topic
item.source: Which File handles the runescape map area?

item.title: Which File handles the runescape map area?
item.dc:creator: @Phaze_One Fuscate
item.description:
@Phaze_One wrote:

Maps are handled directly through cache file .idx4. Usually a blank map is a result from a corrupt cache or invalid/missing mapdata

Read full topic
